Content_wSideColumn.Name: Archiving - Outlook 2010
Content_wSideColumn.Title: How to archive folders from Outlook 2010
Content_wSideColumn.Abstract: How to archive email at BYUI using Outlook 2010

MoveLeft.label: Toggle column right or left (right is default)

fbookTop.label: Put facebook at top of page

fbookDisplayed.label: Number of facebook messages to display

Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
Archiving in Outlook 2010

  • BYU-Idaho mailbox quotas are 500MB.
  • Archiving relieves your server quota by moving items to your PC storage.
  • Procedure (Manual):
    • File --> Cleanup Tools --> Archive...
    • Archive this folder and all subfolders
    • Select folder
    • Select "Archive all items older than" date
    • Click "OK"
    • For more detail please check out http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/outlook-help/archive-items-manually-HA010355564.aspx.
  • Procedure (AutoArchive):
    • Auto Archive is not enabled by default. To turn it on:
      • click on the File tab to access Backstage View
      • then click on Options.
    • The Outlook Options window opens then click on Advanced then the AutoArchive Settings button.

    Accessing Archives

    Generally when you archive you'll see that archive in the left navigation area in Outlook.  If, for whatever reason it's not there, here's how to access it:

    Outlook 2010

    1. File
    2. Open
    3. Open Outlook Data File
    4. Browse to the location of your "archive.pst" file (usually c:\Users\netID\Documents\Outlook Files\archive.pst)
